title.value: Asymmetric stimulus representations bias visual perceptual learning
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as given in the citation section and throughout the paper.
title.quote: Citation: Laamerad, P., Awada, A., Pack, C. C., & Bakhtiari, S. (2024). Asymmetric stimulus representations bias visual perceptual learning. Journal of Vision, 24(1):10, 1–16, https://doi.org/10.1167/jov.24.1.10.

extractions.description: The paper investigates how asymmetric stimulus representations in the visual cortex influence visual perceptual learning, using human observers trained on optic flow tasks. It explores optimal and suboptimal learning strategies, using neural network models to account for observed perceptual biases.

type.justification: The paper involves training human observers in experimental tasks and simulating neural networks to evaluate learning strategies. This involves data collection and analysis.
type.quote: To understand these dynamics, we compared neural networks that were trained to perform the same psychophysical task with different learning rules.

name.justification: The study is primarily concerned with visual perception and learning, focusing on how visual stimuli are processed in the visual cortex.
name.quote: The primate visual cortex contains various regions that exhibit specialization for different stimulus properties, such as motion, shape, and color.

name.justification: The study specifically focuses on learning visual discrimination tasks, particularly on how learning occurs for visual perceptual tasks.
name.quote: Training-induced improvements in perceptual abilities, known as visual perceptual learning (VPL), have been suggested to arise from adjustments in sensory neuron tuning.

name.justification: The paper uses neural network models to simulate learning processes and understand perceptual biases.
name.quote: To understand these dynamics, we compared neural networks that were trained to perform the same psychophysical task with different learning rules.

name.justification: The paper uses neural network models to simulate learning processes and account for observed biases in human perceptual learning.
name.quote: We simulated different neural network models and found that a learning rule that involved only adjustments to decision criteria...

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim to contribute a new neural network model, but rather uses existing models to simulate tasks.
is_contributed.quote: We simulated different neural network models...

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses simulation results of these models in the context of the study.
is_executed.quote: We simulated different neural network models and found that a learning rule that involved...

is_compared.justification: The study compares different learning rules within the neural network models to explain perceptual learning biases.
is_compared.quote: We compared neural networks that were trained to perform the same psychophysical task with different learning rules.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The models are not explicitly attributed to a specific paper in the text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We simulated different neural network models...

name.justification: The models are classified into optimal and suboptimal types based on their learning strategy.
name.quote: Among them, only a suboptimal learning rule involving the adjustment of decision criteria was able to account for...

is_contributed.justification: The paper evaluates specific learning strategies classified as optimal and suboptimal for the visual learning tasks.
is_contributed.quote: The psychophysical results presented in the previous section reveal the following pattern of perceptual effects.

is_executed.justification: These models were executed to understand and compare the effects on perceptual learning.
is_executed.quote: Among them, only a suboptimal learning rule involving the adjustment...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the effects of different learning strategies, which include optimal and suboptimal models.
is_compared.quote: The meaning of 'comparison' is given in the text: 'We compared neural networks that were trained to perform the...''

referenced_paper_title.justification: The models are discussed as part of this study's findings rather than being directly referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The study specifically mentions these model types as part of its investigation: 'Among them, only a suboptimal learning rule...'

name.justification: The paper mentions using the MATLAB Palamedes toolbox for data analysis.
name.quote: The observers’ performance as a function of coherence was characterized by fitting a Weibull function to the proportion of correct responses using the maximal likelihood algorithm (MATLAB Palamedes toolbox for analyzing psychophysical data)

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is a widely known toolbox and not specific to a particular referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The observers’ performance as a function of coherence was characterized by fitting a Weibull function to the proportion of correct responses using the maximal likelihood algorithm (MATLAB Palamedes toolbox for analyzing psychophysical data)
